snippet: In interviews across Gaza, many Palestinians insisted they could withstand much more to achieve their goals of opening borders and removing Israeli restrictions on imports and exports.
abstract: Palestinians in Gaza are exhausted, but hold on to hope that war will bring change; countless villages have been demolished, at least 10,000 homes have been destroyed and at least 1,900 lives have been lost.
lead_paragraph: In interviews across Gaza, many Palestinians insisted they could withstand much more to achieve their goals of opening borders and removing Israeli restrictions on imports and exports.

headline.main: In Gaza, Grief, Anger — and No Small Measure of Pride
headline.print_headline: In a Palestinian Town, Growing Weary of a War and Hoping for Change

keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
keywords.name: organizations
